text:
Well, here we are again
eight years later.

I'm forever Hastie,
and this is my friend--
Rob.
Rob Tibshirani.
Thank you, my old buddy, Trevor.

And may I say you
haven't changed one bit.
You look great.
Oh, thank you, Rob.

Well, we're here filming the
second edition of our MOOC
lectures on our course, intro--
Duction to statistical learning.
Statistical learning.

You can take your
costume off now.
It's off, Rob.
Oh, OK, sorry.

So welcome to the second
edition of our lectures
on statistical learning.

We have some new
lectures to accompany

the new edition of our
book, and the lectures

will be on deep learning,
survival analysis,

and multiple testing as
long as a few other topics.

In addition, you'll
notice if you

look in the book, which is also
freely available on our websites

and on the book
website, you'll notice

there's a few little extra
pieces in various chapters.

So in chapter four,
we have a new section
on generalized linear models.

In the unsupervised
learning chapter,

we have a section on
matrix completion.
And there's one more, Rob.

BART in the tree--
the tree chapter,

Bayesian additive
regression models, BART.

The rest of the course
is the same as before,

so we haven't reformed
those lectures.
The material is the same.

And, of course, there's labs
for the new material as well.
So we hope you enjoy it.

In addition, in the first
edition of the course,

we had interviews with some
famous people in our field.
Well, we have more of those.
Right.

We've added-- we've interview
with David Cox on survival

analysis, Jeff Hinton
on deep learning,

and Yoav Benjamini on multiple
testing and false discovery
rates.

So we hope you enjoy the
second edition of the course.
